svg.title: Synchronization in Flocks with Large Population

g.title: 1. Why Do Bird Flocks Move in Unison?
g.text: 1. Why Do Bird Flocks Move in Unison?

g.title: 2. Incredible FLOCK of BIRDS Flying on the Sky of Norway
g.text: 2. Incredible FLOCK of BIRDS Flying on the Sky of Norway

g.title: In this lecture, we will consider the synchronization problem of some basic classes of flocks with large population, without resorting to any connectivity assumptions imposed on the dynamical trajectories of the flocks. Furthermore, we will consider how to intervene the collective behaviors of the flocks without changing the existing interaction rules of the agents. The main theorems are established based on analyses of the nonlinear dynamical equations involved and of the asymptotical properties of the spectrum of the corresponding random graphs.

Professor GUO Lei received his B.S. degree in mathematics from Shandong University in 1982, and Ph.D. degree in control theory from the CAS in 1987. He has been the President of the Academy of Mathematics and Systems Science, and is currently the Director of the National Center for Mathematics and Interdisciplinary Sciences, CAS.
